option.name: SECURITY
option.comment: Flag to control if HTTP and HTTPS are both supported by Apache or not,It will not affect SOAP/XML access
MIXED : support both
SECURED: only suppport HTTPS

option.name: Enable
option.comment: If yes, the psacct service will be enable. If no this function will be disable

option.name: Partition_Size
option.comment: Supports G-byte value only
The partition size for /var/account/psacct where psacct log files will be maintained
The default value and the minum is 5G, the maximum is 10G

option.name: Rotate_Interval
option.comment: The rotate parameter for psacct logrotate
The valid values can be: daily, weekly, monthly and yearly

option.name: Log_Size
option.comment: Supports M-byte value only
The size limit for psacct logrotate

option.name: sshCiphers
option.comment: SSH server configuration
Specifies the ciphers allowed
(symmetric algorithms used to encode all the data during the session)

option.name: httpClientAllowed1
option.comment: HTTP configuration
List of clients allowed to access the HTTP server.
Accepted values : IP address
Several values, separated by spaces, can be provided
See httpd.apache.org, module "mod_access", directive "allow" for a complete description.
httpClientAllowedi=host (i start from 1 to ..)

option.name: SECURE_CONNECTION_MODE_TO_SDM
option.comment: yes or no
If set to yes, 8650 homepage will not be displayed before "term of use" show up and user be authenticated.
Recommand to set to yes for security concern

option.name: httpRealm
option.comment: httpRealm

option.name: httpPasswordOnFiles
option.comment: list of files protected by a password

option.name: apacheBanner
option.default_value: WARNING! This computer system and network is PRIVATE and PROPRIETARY and may only be accessed by authorized users. Unauthorized use of this computer system or network is strictly prohibited and may be subject to criminal prosecution, employee discipline up to and including discharge, or the termination of vendor/service contracts. The owner, or its agents, may monitor any activity or communication on the computer system or network. The owner, or its agents, may retrieve any information stored within the computer system or network. By accessing and using this computer system or network, you are consenting to such monitoring and information retrieval for law enforcement and other purposes. Users should have no expectation of privacy as to any communication on or information stored within the computer system or network, including information stored locally or remotely on a hard drive or other media in use with this computer system or network.
option.example: Anyone accessing or attempting to access the IS without authorisation runs the risk of a one-year prison sentence and a fine of 15,244 euros (New criminal Code - Article 323-1)
option.comment: apache server configuration
In some jurisdictions, sending a warning message
before authentication may be relevant for getting legal protection.
This text will be saved in /vendorpackages/Apache/webserver/conf/tomix-warning-banner.txt
and apache will be configured to display it on each new session.
Default : no warning message

option.name: httpForbidLinkFromOutsite
option.comment: Allow or Forbid links to heavy files from outsides

option.name: UseOfficialCertificate
option.comment: It is used to decide whether use customer trusted certificate or not.
If yes, use customer trusted certificate, else will use the default certificate.
If yes, the file /cust_use/SDM/cust_cert/server_cert.pem and /cust_use/SDM/cust_cert/server_key.pem must be delivered.
The certificate must be not expired and No pass-phrase encryption.
The CN in the certificate must match with the external hostname.

option.name: CONFIGURATION
option.comment: Node configuration type
Value: FE, BE, CS, CM, EBE, Prov-FE

option.name: HARDWARE
option.comment: Hardware type
Value: ROUZIC,BONO24, BONO48, HPG6, HPG8, DL380G8, DL380G6, ML350G6 or VM

option.name: tableID_Start
option.comment: tableID for sourceIP routing
range: 1~200

option.name: Private_VLAN1
option.comment: This option is only for Rouzic hardware
If Rouzic Upgarde, this option must be set a value
Else leave it blank

option.name: Private_VLAN2
option.comment: This option is only for Rouzic hardware
If Rouzic Upgarde, this option must be set a value
Else leave it blank

option.name: CM_Mode
option.comment: Mode for compact mated-pair
Value: CC, CD
CC: replication traffic share with OAM flux, only generate siteinfo configuration file
CD: different flux for OAM and replication, generate siteinfo and repl.ini configuration file

option.name: SYSTEM_PREFIX
option.comment: System prefix, and the system hostname of floating address
Format: character of '0-9', 'a-z', 'A-Z' and '_' are only allowed, max length 32
recommended length is less than 16
It is mapped to SI_SYSTEM_PREFIX in siteinfo

option.name: NUMBER_OF_SERVERS
option.comment: Number of services, used to support scalable chassis
Value for DL380G8, DL380G6, ML350G6: 1
Value for ROUZIC, BONO24 and BONO48: 4, 6, 8, 10, 12
Value for HPG6 and HPG8: 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14, 16
1: Equiped blades: 0
4: Equiped blades: 1, 2, 9, 10
6: Equiped blades: 1, 2, 3, 9, 10, 11
It is mapped to SI_NUMBER_OF_SERVERS in siteinfo

option.name: LSN_SUBNET
option.comment: LSN network address
It is mapped to SI_LSN_SUBNET in siteinfo
recommand to set 169.254 if no confict

option.name: CLUSTER_SITE_ID
option.comment: Cluster site id in msgh cluster network
For BE, it must be 1
It is mapped to SI_CLUSTER_SITE_ID in siteinfo

option.name: BLADE_SINGLE_CHASSIS
option.comment: Indicate if this is a Single Bladed Chassis system.

Typically this will not need to be changed, unless it is expected that this system will be limited to a single bladed Chassis and will share a frame with another single bladed Chassis system. This parameter has no effect on RMS systems, only on bladed systems
no - This is not a single chassis system (default)
bottom - This is a single chassis system located in the bottom "half" of the frame
top - This is a single chassis system located in the top "half" of the frame
It is mapped to SI_BLADE_SINGLE_CHASSIS in siteinfo

option.name: INTERNAL_SWITCH_TYPE
option.comment: For ROUZIC, INTERNAL_SWITCH_TYPE should be MALBAN
For BONO24 and BONO48, INTERNAL_SWITCH_TYPE should be MALBAN10
For HPG6 and HPG8, INTERNAL_SWITCH_TYPE should be PROCURVE6120
It is mapped to SI_INTERNAL_SWITCH_TYPE in siteinfo

option.name: TIMEZONE
option.comment: Provide the timezone for the system
Can be anything defined under /usr/share/zoneinfo
It is mapped to SI_TIMEZONE in siteinfo

option.name: NTPSERVER_PRIM
option.comment: Primary NTP server IP. If defined, this will create an entry in RCV:MENU form 2.7 with event ID of NTP to call set:time, to adjust clock
It is mapped to SI_NTPSERVER_PRIM in siteinfo

option.name: NTPSERVER_SEC
option.comment: Secondary NTP server IPs. Default for NTPSERVER_SEC is the value of NTPSERVER_PRIM.
It is mapped to SI_NTPSERVER_SEC in siteinfo

option.name: NTPSERVER_THRESHOLD
option.comment: It specifies the threshold for the time gap between the current system and NTP server, whose range is 1-20 in second
It will report an alarm when the time gap between the current system and NTP server is greater than the threshold
It will clear the alarm when the time gap between the current system and NTP server is less than the threshold

option.name: PLATDB_SIZE
option.comment: This specifies the size of the platform database partition (/platdb)
range is 1-20 in gigabytes(G)
It is mapped to SI_PLATDB_SIZE in siteinfo

option.name: DOMAIN_NAME
option.comment: Domain name
It is mapped to SI_DOMAIN_NAME in siteinfo

option.name: RESOLVER_1
option.comment: DNS server address
It is mapped to SI_RESOLVER_1 in siteinfo

option.name: RESOLVER_2
option.comment: DNS server address
It is mapped to SI_RESOLVER_2 in siteinfo

option.name: FASTCACHE_PAIR
option.comment: FASTCACHE paired blades. Colon separated RCS values. First RCS value must be PilotA.
It is mapped to SI_FASTCACHE_PAIR in siteinfo

option.name: MAXNODES_PER_SYSTEM
option.comment: This specifies the maximum number of allowed nodes per system
This number should be the largest system supported in the cluster.
It must be the same in all the siteinfo files on all the other systems in the cluster.
It is mapped to SI_MAXNODES_PER_SYSTEM in siteinfo

option.name: DDM_MODE
option.comment: For FE and Prov-FE, set to DEFAULT
For Replicated EBE, set to BACKUP
For Non-Replicated EBE, set to STANDALONE
For BE, set to PREFERENTIAL_MASTER or DEFAULT
For compact, set to STANDALONE, PRIMARY or BACKUP
It is mapped to SI_DDM_MODE in siteinfo

option.name: DDM_POINT_IN_TIME_BACKUP
option.comment: If it is set to yes, the point in time feature is opened, then all the DB data content will be backup at a precise time.

option.name: ENABLE_BACKUP_TRANSACTION_LOG
option.comment: Activation/deactivation of backup transaction log

option.name: AUTOMATIC_TRANSACTION_LOG_SAVE
option.comment: Activation/deactivation of automatic tar of increment log files in backup repository

option.name: BACKUP_TRANSACTION_SAVE_PERIOD
option.comment: Setting granularity of transaction log save period 15mn to 120 mn by step of 15 mn
On BONO24G and BONO48G, the RECOMMENDED VALUE: 60
On HPG6 and HPG8, the RECOMMENDED VALUE: 15
On Rouzic, the RECOMMENDED VALUE: 60

option.name: BACKUP_TRANSACTION_LOG_INC_FORMAT
option.comment: Setting of the format of increment backup files

option.name: MAX_TIME_WITHOUT_BACKUP
option.comment: transaction log automatically stopped if no new Backup launched after MAX_TIME_WITHOUT_BACKUP hours
On BONO24G and BONO48G, the RECOMMENDED VALUE: 30
On HPG6 and HPG8, the RECOMMENDED VALUE: 72
On Rouzic, the RECOMMENDED VALUE: 30

option.name: REPLICATION_BACKUP_PORT
option.comment: TCP port on which the mysqld server launched for transaction logging listens to

option.name: MANAGE_STALE_STATUS
option.comment: Set the mated pair stale status management
no: stale status is not manage in slave
yes: stale status is manage in slave

option.name: QUICK_SWITCHOVER
option.comment: Allowed to not wait for replication complete on slave to launch mated pair switchover
no: wait for replication complete before launching mated pair switchover
yes: don't wait for replication complete before launching mated pair switchover

option.name: FILE_TRANSFER_PROTOCOL_WITH_DB_NODES
option.comment: Transfer mode to use for database backup between pilot and cluster nodes
Allowed values are: FTP, SFTP

option.name: SELECT_LARGER_BINLOG_IF_DOUBLE_MASTER
option.comment: Set the mated pair behaviour when two mated pair platforms becomes master
Allowed values are: yes, no
no: the older master platform mated pair status becomes slave
yes: the older master getting larger binlog size to replicate remain master the other one becomes slave

option.name: DDM_SFTP
option.comment: transfer mode for database backup between mated pair peers
allowed value: allowed, no
It is mapped to SI_DDM_SFTP in siteinfo

option.name: DDM_USE_GANGLIA
option.comment: DDM parameter, DDM will use ganglia if set to yes
It can't be set to yes when DDM_USE_NEW_GANGLIA is set to yes
It can only be set to yes from SDM4.0
It is mapped to SI_DDM_USE_GANGLIA in siteinfo

option.name: DDM_USE_NEW_GANGLIA
option.comment: DDM parameter, DDM will use new ganglia if set to yes.
It can't be set to yes when DDM_USE_GANGLIA is set to yes
It can only be set to no from SDM4.0
It is mapped to SI_DDM_USE_NEW_GANGLIA in siteinfo

option.name: DDM_OBS_WITH_GANGLIA
option.comment: DDM parameter, DDM will use ganglia for observation
It is mapped to SI_DDM_OBS_WITH_GANGLIA in siteinfo

option.name: SWITCHOVER_LOW_LEVEL
option.comment: A manual switchover request is delayed until the synchronization delta is lower than SWITCHOVER_LOW_LEVEL (byte)
DDM-related parameter, added for SDM 2608
CS, ROUZIC = 1000000
BE, ROUZIC = 1000000
CM, ROUZIC = 1000000

option.name: SWITCHOVER_LOW_LEVEL_AUTOMATIC
option.comment: An automatic switchover request is delayed until the synchronization delta is lower than SWITCHOVER_LOW_LEVEL_AUTOMATIC (byte)
DDM-related parameter, added for SDM 2608
CS, ROUZIC = 3000000
BE, ROUZIC = 3000000
CM, ROUZIC = 3000000

option.name: SWITCHOVER_HIGH_LEVEL
option.comment: A manual switchover request is rejected if the synchronization delta is greater than SWITCHOVER_HIGH_LEVEL (byte)
DDM-related parameter, added for SDM 2608
CS, ROUZIC = 5000000
BE, ROUZIC = 5000000
CM, ROUZIC = 5000000

option.name: SWITCHOVER_DATA_LOST_LEVEL
option.comment: An automatic switchover is launched without synchronization with master if the synchronization delta is greater than SWITCHOVER_DATA_LOST_LEVEL (byte)
DDM-related parameter, added for SDM 2608
CS, ROUZIC = 3000000
BE, ROUZIC = 3000000
CM, ROUZIC = 3000000

option.name: NOT_SECURED_LEVEL
option.comment: Threshold (bytes) used to control if the Master/Slave databases securization,The Master database is secured by the Slave database, when the data amount to be transfered to the Slave database, is under this threshold
DDM-related parameter, added for SDM 2608
CS, ROUZIC = 5400000
BE, ROUZIC = 5400000
CM, ROUZIC = 5400000

option.name: DSCP_Enable
option.comment: DSCP enable flag
If yes, DSCP for all traffic can be enabled, else DSCP can't be enabled

option.name: NRG_key
option.comment: NRG Key in NRG network
It is mapped to X within NRG.X.ZONE.Y and it will determine which BE.NETWORK.NRG.{#}.ZONE.{#}/EBE.NETWORK.NRG.{#} will be used to generate gdmp/distributed/repl(for BE/EBE) ini files

option.name: Zone_id
option.comment: Zone id
It is possibly mapped to Y within NRG.X.ZONE.Y and it will determine which BE.NETWORK.NRG.{#}.ZONE.{#} will be used to generate gdmp/distributed/repl(for BE) ini files
It is able to mapped to ZONE for FE in distributed.ini file

option.name: NRG_Num
option.comment: NRG Number, DDM parameter "NbReplyThreads" dependence on this value

option.name: FE_KEY
option.comment: FE number valued from 1 (default value) to N
This identifier must be unique in the network
1 is associated to first FE created.
The FE_KEY is incremented (+1) on each new FE creation.
It is mapped to FE_KEY in distributed.ini

option.name: SS7_PAIR
option.comment: The blades will start SS7 service
If Multiple pairs, use "/" as the separator

option.name: SS7_enable
option.comment: If YES, SS7 traffic will be enabled

option.name: SYSTEM_TS0
option.comment: Defines the transport layer protocol standard to be used for SS7 messaging and routing.
Valid entries for the SS7 transport layer protocol are "89" for SCTP/M3UA or "90" for SCTP/M2PA.

option.name: SYSTEM_SS7FORMAT
option.comment: Defines the point code format standard to be used for SS7 protocol messaging and routing.
Valid entries for the SS7 point code format are "ANSI", "CHN" or "ITU".

option.name: SS7_NUMBER_OF_PROCS
option.comment: Defines the number of SS7 stacks that will be installed in each SS7 I/O Node.
Valid entries are 1 to 4.

option.name: SS7_PARAM_SCP_DIST_SS7
option.comment: Defines whether the system will run multiple SS7stacks or single SS7 stacks in each SS7 I/O Node.
Valid entries are M for Multi-process mode or C for Cluster mode.

option.name: SS_NFS_1_CLIENTS
option.comment: This option is only for Rouzic hardware
Defines which blades will be used for NFS clients
If you want to enable NFS, this option must be set a value
Else leave it blank

option.name: NFS_SDMCORE_SIZE
option.comment: If you want to configure the size of /sdmcore, this option should be set a value, the unit is G
Else leave it blank, use the defaule value 10G

option.name: EBE_INVOLVED
option.comment: This option indicates whether EBE is introduced
The valid value is "yes" or "no"
"yes": EBE is introduced
"no": There's no EBE introduced

option.name: Replicated_EBE
option.comment: This option indicates the EBE type
The valid value is "yes" or "no"
"yes" means Replicated EBE is introduced
"no" means Non-Replicated EBE is introduced
If "yes", Replication_Traffic and EBE.NETWORK.NRG.x are mandatory
If "no", No need to set Replication_Traffic and EBE.NETWORK.NRG.x

option.name: BE_HARDWARE_Serving_EBE
option.comment: This parameter is mandatory for Replicated and Non-Replicated EBE
It defines the hardware type of BE serving EBE
The valid value can be ROUZIC,BONO24,BONO48,HPG6 or HPG8

option.name: sshTunnel
option.comment: Flag for SSH tunnel function enable
If set to yes, 8650 SDM shall support SSH access on the OAMP interface using a routable IP address on the control station
using SSH tunneling/port forwarding through the control station to access other RT/DB blades and MALBANswitch in the same FE/BE nodes

option.name: EXTERNAL_NETWORK_IP
option.comment: This option is used for generating iptables rules
This option will only be used by gen_nat.sh
This value indicates OAM destination IP
Mapping section "EXTERNALS.SRC-OAM" and "EXTERNALS.SRC-PILOT" in network.ini

option.name: internal_interface
option.comment: internal interface used by nonpilot stations
It is mapped to SI_NONPILOT_X_INTERNAL_INTERFACES in siteinfo

option.name: 0-0-1.MAC1
option.comment: MAC address of specific station
This parameter is mandatory once the blade is equiped
The list of equiped blades is decided by NUMBERS_OF_SERVERS.
It is mapped to SI_PILOT_A_MAC1 in siteinfo

option.name: 0-0-1.MAC2
option.comment: MAC address of specific station
This parameter is mandatory once the blade is equiped
The list of equiped blades is decided by NUMBERS_OF_SERVERS.
It is mapped to SI_PILOT_A_MAC2 in siteinfo

option.name: 0-0-2.MAC1
option.comment: MAC address of specific station
This parameter is mandatory once the blade is equiped
The list of equiped blades is decided by NUMBERS_OF_SERVERS.

This parameter is mandatory once the blade is equiped

This parameter is mandatory once the blade is equiped

This parameter is mandatory once the blade is equiped

This parameter is mandatory once the blade is equiped

option.name: 0-0-6.MAC1
option.comment: MAC address of specific station
This parameter is mandatory once the blade is equiped
The list of equiped blades is decided by NUMBERS_OF_SERVERS.
It is mapped to SI_NONPILOT_9_MAC1 in siteinfo

option.name: 0-0-6.MAC2
option.comment: MAC address of specific station
This parameter is mandatory once the blade is equiped

This parameter is mandatory once the blade is equiped

This parameter is mandatory once the blade is equiped

option.comment: MAC address of specific station
This parameter is mandatory once the blade is equiped

It is mapped to SI_NONPILOT_2_MAC1 in siteinfo

option.name: 0-0-10.MAC2
option.comment: MAC address of specific station
This parameter is mandatory once the blade is equiped

option.comment: MAC address of specific station
This parameter is mandatory once the blade is equiped
The list of equiped blades is decided by NUMBERS_OF_SERVERS.

option.comment: MAC address of specific station
This parameter is mandatory once the blade is equiped

This parameter is mandatory once the blade is equiped

This parameter is mandatory once the blade is equiped

This parameter is mandatory once the blade is equiped

option.name: 0-0-14.MAC2
option.comment: MAC address of specific station
This parameter is mandatory once the blade is equiped
The list of equiped blades is decided by NUMBERS_OF_SERVERS.
It is mapped to SI_NONPILOT_10_MAC2 in siteinfo

option.name: Enable
option.comment: If YES,this traffic will be enabled.
If NO, below parameters will be ignored.

option.name: Gateway
option.comment: IP address of gateway for GDMP traffic
It is mapped to GATEWAY in gdmp.ini
For ROUZIC hardware, the Gateway value need not to be set

option.name: DSCP_Value
option.comment: DSCP value for GDMP connection, only work when DSCP_Enable is set to yes

option.name: DSCP_Enable
option.comment: DSCP enable flag for GDMP
Workable only when global DSCP is enabled;if it is yes ,DSCP for GDMP will be enabled, else DSCP for GDMP will be disabled

option.name: VLAN_ID
option.comment: For ROUZIC hardware, the VLAN_ID need not to be set
If VLAN_ID is set, the vlan tag is enabled
If not, the vlan tag is disabled
VLAN ID for GDMP Traffic on uplinks to customer router/switch
VLAN ID range is 2 ~ 4096

option.name: Interface
option.comment: ethx or ethx/ethy
recommended value is generated through gen_siteinfo.py -t per different hardware
both BONO and HP are eth0/eth1 for GDMP traffic
not recommand to change this value
For ROUZIC hardware, the interface value need not to be set

option.name: Switch_Port
option.comment: physical Port in internal switch
not recommand to change this value
For ROUZIC hardware, the Switch_Port value need not to be set

option.name: Source_IP_Routing_enable
option.comment: value should be yes or no
if yes,source ip routing and destination routing will be both effective
if not, only destination routing will be effective
for the ROUZIC hardware, the value will be unconcerned

option.name: 0-0-1.address
option.comment: IP address of station 0-0-1 in GDMP network
This parameter is mandatory once the blade is equiped
The list of equiped blades is decided by NUMBERS_OF_SERVERS.
each GDMP ADDRESS is mapped of GDMP:STATION_xx in gdmp.ini

option.name: 0-0-2.address
option.comment: IP address of station 0-0-2 in GDMP network
This parameter is mandatory once the blade is equiped
The list of equiped blades is decided by NUMBERS_OF_SERVERS.
refer to explanaton of "0-0-1.address"

option.name: 0-0-3.address
option.comment: IP address of station 0-0-3 in GDMP network
This parameter is mandatory once the blade is equiped
The list of equiped blades is decided by NUMBERS_OF_SERVERS.
refer to explanaton of "0-0-1.address"

option.name: 0-0-4.address
option.comment: IP address of station 0-0-4 in GDMP network
This parameter is mandatory once the blade is equiped
The list of equiped blades is decided by NUMBERS_OF_SERVERS.
refer to explanaton of "0-0-1.address"

option.name: 0-0-5.address
option.comment: IP address of station 0-0-5 in GDMP network
This parameter is mandatory once the blade is equiped
The list of equiped blades is decided by NUMBERS_OF_SERVERS.
refer to explanaton of "0-0-1.address"

option.name: 0-0-6.address
option.comment: IP address of station 0-0-6 in GDMP network
This parameter is mandatory once the blade is equiped
The list of equiped blades is decided by NUMBERS_OF_SERVERS.
refer to explanaton of "0-0-1.address"

option.name: 0-0-9.address
option.comment: IP address of station 0-0-9 in GDMP network
This parameter is mandatory once the blade is equiped
The list of equiped blades is decided by NUMBERS_OF_SERVERS.
refer to explanaton of "0-0-1.address"

option.name: 0-0-10.address
option.comment: IP address of station 0-0-10 in GDMP network
This parameter is mandatory once the blade is equiped

option.name: Route_Target
option.comment: Route inforamtion for GDMP traffic explicitly
each ip address will be seperated by white space
If the hardware is ROUZIC, no need to set this value
For BE node, route to FE nodes must be added explicitly(BE nodes in NRG will be added default,no needed defined here
For FE node, route to BE node in NRG nodes must be added explicitly
It is mapped to ROUTES in gdmp.ini

option.name: Enable
option.comment: If YES,this traffic will be enabled.
If NO, below parameters will be ignored.

option.name: Gateway
option.comment: IP address of gateway for replication traffic
It is mapped to GATEWAY in repl.ini
For ROUZIC hardware, the Gateway value need not to be set

option.name: DSCP_Value
option.comment: DSCP value for replication connection, only work when DSCP_Enable is set to yes

option.name: DSCP_Enable
option.comment: DSCP enable flag for replication
Workable only when global DSCP is enabled;if it is yes ,DSCP for replication will be enabled, else DSCP for replication will be disabled

option.name: VLAN_ID
option.comment: For ROUZIC hardware, the VLAN_ID need not to be set
If VLAN_ID is set, the vlan tag is enabled
If not, the vlan tag is disabled
VLAN ID for Replication Traffic on uplinks to customer router/switch
VLAN ID range is 2 ~ 4096

option.name: Interface
option.comment: ethx or ethx/ethy
recommended value is generated through gen_siteinfo.py -t per different hardware
both BONO and HP are eth0/eth1 for replication traffic
not recommand to change this value
For ROUZIC hardware, the Interface value need not to be set

option.name: Switch_Port
option.comment: physical Port in internal switch
not recommand to change this value
For ROUZIC hardware, the Switch_Port value need not to be set

option.name: Source_IP_Routing_enable
option.comment: value should be yes or no
if yes,source ip routing and destination routing will be both effective
if not, only destination routing will be effective
for ROUZIC hardware, the value will be unconcerned

option.name: Enable
option.comment: If YES, this traffic will be enabled.
If NO, below parameters will be ignored.

option.name: Gateway
option.comment: IP address of gateway for OAM traffic
It is mapped to SI_EXTERNAL_GATEWAY_IP in siteinfo
For ROUZIC hardware, the Gateway value need not to be set

option.name: DSCP_Value
option.comment: DSCP value for OAM connection, only work when DSCP_Enable is set to yes

option.name: DSCP_Enable
option.comment: DSCP enable flag for OAM
Workable only when global DSCP is enabled; if it is yes ,DSCP for OAM will be enabled, else DSCP for OAM will be disabled

option.name: VLAN_ID
option.comment: If VLAN_ID is set, the vlan tag is enabled
If not, the vlan tag is disabled
VLAN ID for OAM Traffic on uplinks to customer router/switch
VLAN ID range is 2 ~ 4096
For ROUZIC hardware, the VLAN_ID need not to be set

option.name: Interface
option.comment: ethx or ethx/ethy
recommended value is generated through gen_siteinfo.py -t per different hardware
BONO is eth4/eth5 and HP is eth0/eth1 for OAM traffic
not recommand to change this value
For ROUZIC hardware, the Interface value need not to be set

option.name: Switch_Port
option.comment: physical Port in internal switch
not recommand to change this value
For ROUZIC hardware, the Switch_Port value need not to be set

option.name: 0-0-1.address
option.comment: IP address of station 0-0-1 for OAM connection
It is mapped to SI_EXTERNAL_IP_A in siteinfo

option.name: 0-0-9.address
option.comment: IP address of station 0-0-9 for OAM connection
It is mapped to SI_EXTERNAL_IP_B in siteinfo

option.name: float.address
option.comment: floating IP address of station 0-0-1/0-0-9 for OAM connection
It is mapped to SI_EXTERNAL_FLOATING_IP in siteinfo

option.name: floatIP_mode
option.comment: mode for VIP brought up to control source IP binding.
Validate value: none, bounce, down

none: Static IP is brought up first (primary), and is used for source IP binding. At some point later, node transitions to Active, VIP is brought up. Static IP remains primary and is continued to be used for source IP binding.

bounce: Static IP is brought up first (primary), and is used for source IP binding. At some point later, node transitions to Active, VIP is brought up. VIP has static_handling set to bounce. After VIP is brought up, Static IP is torn down and brought back up. VIP becomes primary and is used for source IP binding.

If down. Static IP is brought up first (primary), and is used for source IP binding. At some point later, node transitions to Active, VIP is brought up. VIP has static_handling set to down. After VIP is brought up, Static IP is torn down. VIP becomes primary (only IP still up), and is used for source IP binding.
It is mapped to SI_EXTERNAL_FLOATING_IP_STATIC_HANDLING in siteinfo

option.name: Enable
option.comment: If YES, secondary provisioning will be enabled. Below parameters about ip configuration must be configured,this subnet will be used to handle provisioning traffic and OAM subnet will process OAM maintainence traffic;after it is enable, only the client which belongs to the route target of second Provision network can access SDM GUI and make provision operation
If NO, below parameters will be ignored.

option.name: Gateway
option.comment: IP address of gateway for secondary provisioning traffic
It is GATEWAY within SI_EXTNET_{#}_ROUTE_{##}_ARGS in siteinfo
For ROUZIC hardware, the Gateway value need not to be set

option.name: DSCP_Value
option.comment: DSCP value for secondary provisioning connection, only work when DSCP_Enable is set to yes

option.name: DSCP_Enable
option.comment: DSCP enable flag for secondary provisioning
Workable only when global DSCP is enabled; if it is yes, DSCP for secondary provisioning will be enabled, else DSCP for secondary provisioning will be disabled

option.name: VLAN_ID
option.comment: If VLAN_ID is set, the vlan tag is enabled
If not, the vlan tag is disabled
VLAN ID for secondary provisioning on uplinks to customer router/switch
VLAN ID range is 2 ~ 4096
For ROUZIC hardware, the VLAN_ID need not to be set

option.name: Interface
option.comment: ethx or ethx/ethy
recommended value is generated through gen_siteinfo.py -t per different hardware
BONO is eth4/eth5 and HP is eth0/eth1 for secondary provisioning traffic
not recommand to change this value
For ROUZIC hardware, the Interface value need not to be set

option.name: Switch_Port
option.comment: physical Port in internal switch
not recommand to change this value
For ROUZIC hardware, the Switch_Port value need not to be set

option.name: Source_IP_Routing_enable
option.comment: value should be yes or no
if yes,source ip routing and destination routing will be both effective
if not, only destination routing will be effective
for ROUZIC hardware, the value will be unconcerned

option.name: float.address
option.comment: floating IP address of station 0-0-1/0-0-9 for secondary provisioning connection
It is IP_ADDR within SI_EXTNET_{#}_HOST_{##}_ARGS for SecP in siteinfo

option.name: 0-0-1.address
option.comment: IP address of station 0-0-1 for secondary provisioning connection
It is IP_ADDR within SI_EXTNET_{#}_HOST_{##}_ARGS for SecP in siteinfo

option.name: 0-0-9.address
option.comment: IP address of station 0-0-9 for secondary provisioning connection
It is IP_ADDR within SI_EXTNET_{#}_HOST_{##}_ARGS for SecP in siteinfo

option.name: floatIP_mode
option.comment: mode for VIP brought up to control source IP binding.
Validate value: none, bounce, down

none: Static IP is brought up first (primary), and is used for source IP binding. At some point later, node transitions to Active, VIP is brought up. Static IP remains primary and is continued to be used for source IP binding.

bounce: Static IP is brought up first (primary), and is used for source IP binding. At some point later, node transitions to Active, VIP is brought up. VIP has static_handling set to bounce. After VIP is brought up, Static IP is torn down and brought back up. VIP becomes primary and is used for source IP binding.

If down. Static IP is brought up first (primary), and is used for source IP binding. At some point later, node transitions to Active, VIP is brought up. VIP has static_handling set to down. After VIP is brought up, Static IP is torn down. VIP becomes primary (only IP still up), and is used for source IP binding.
It is VIP mode within SI_EXTNET_{#}_HOST_{##}_ARGS for SecP in siteinfo

option.name: Route_Target
option.comment: When hardware is ROUZIC or Source_IP_Routing_enable is yes, Route_Target value will not be necessary. Otherwise,route information for secondary privisioning traffic explicitly.
each ip address will be seperated by white space
It is DEST_IP_ADDR within SI_EXTNET_{#}_ROUTE_{##}_ARGS in siteinfo

option.name: Enable
option.comment: If YES, LDAP subnet will be configured and LDAP server will be started on specified blade. Below parameters about ip configuration must be configured

option.name: PILOT.enable
option.comment: Flag to control whether pilot will be started as LDAP server
NO stands for LDAP server will not be started on pilot, YES means pilot will be start LDAP server
This parameter requires pilot.address to be configured once its value is yes.

option.name: PILOT.address
option.comment: floating IP address of station 0-0-1/0-0-9 for LDAP traffic

option.name: PILOT.LDAP_BASIC_ACTIVATED
option.comment: LDAP server enables the non secured port listening.

The VALID VALUE: true or false

option.name: PILOT.LDAP_SECURED_ACTIVATED

option.comment: Set the port for LDAP proxy secured listening port

option.name: PILOT.LDAP_SERVER_INSTANCE_NUMBER
option.comment: This parameter is used only with "dsmgtDB"(management database)
This option allows to launch up to 4 LDAP servers (third party) per blade

This option allows to launch up to 4 LDAP servers (third party) per blade

option.name: 0-0-14.enable
option.comment: Flag to control if 0-0-14 will be started as LDAP server
NO stands for LDAP server will not be started on 0-0-14, YES means 0-0-14 will be start LDAP server
This parameter requires 0-0-14.address to be configured once its value is yes.

option.name: 0-0-14.address
option.comment: IP address of station 0-0-14 for LDAP traffic
This parameter is mandatory once 0-0-14.enable is yes.
It is ADDRESS within [LDAP:STATION_L] for LDAP in ldap.ini

option.name: 0-0-14.LDAP_BASIC_ACTIVATED
option.comment: LDAP server enables the non secured port listening.
If LDAP_SECURED_ACTIVATED is set to false,LDAP_BASIC_ACTIVATED should be set to true
The VALID VALUE: true or false

option.name: 0-0-14.LDAP_SECURED_ACTIVATED
option.comment: LDAP server enables the secured port listening
If LDAP_BASIC_ACTIVATED is set to false,LDAP_SECURED_ACTIVATED should be set to true
The VALID VALUE: true or false

option.name: 0-0-14.LDAP_PROXY.STD_PORT
option.comment: Set the port for LDAP proxy non secured listening port

option.name: 0-0-14.LDAP_PROXY.TLS_PORT
option.comment: Set the port for LDAP proxy secured listening port

option.name: 0-0-14.LDAP_SERVER_INSTANCE_NUMBER
option.comment: This parameter is used only with "dsmgtDB"(management database)
This option allows to launch up to 4 LDAP servers (third party) per blade

option.name: Route_Target
option.comment: When hardware is ROUZIC or Source_IP_Routing_enable is yes, Route_Target value will not be necessary. Otherwise, route information for LDAP traffic explicitly
each ip address will be seperated by white space
It is mapped to ROUTES in ldap.ini

option.name: Enable
option.comment: SIGTRAN traffic is on dual subnet configuration,one pair of blades will be defined as I/O blade
Each blade will be configured with one IP address in each subnet
If YES, sigtran1 traffic will be enabled. Below parameters about ip configuration must be configured
else, below parameters will be ignored

option.name: DSCP_Enable
option.comment: DSCP enable flag for SIGTRAN1 traffic
Workable only when global DSCP is enabled;if it is yes ,DSCP for sigtran1 traffic will be enabled, else DSCP for sigtran1 traffic will be disabled

option.name: DSCP_Value
option.comment: DSCP value for sigtran1 traffic connection, only work when DSCP_Enable is set to yes

option.name: Gateway
option.comment: IP address of gateway for sigtran1 traffic
The gateway can't be same as the one in sigtran2 traffic
It is GATEWAY within SI_EXTNET_{#}_ROUTE_{##}_ARGS in siteinfo

option.name: VLAN_ID
option.comment: If VLAN_ID is set, the vlan tag is enabled
If not, the vlan tag is disabled
VLAN ID for Sigtran1 Traffic on uplinks to customer router/switch
VLAN ID range is 2 ~ 4096
For ROUZIC hardware, the VLAN_ID need not to be set

option.name: Interface
option.comment: ethx or ethx/ethy
recommended value is generated through gen_siteinfo.py -t per different hardware
BONO is eth4 and HP is eth0 for Sigtran1 traffic
not recommand to change this value

option.name: Switch_Port
option.comment: physical Port in internal switch
For HP lab, if use 10/100MB Ethernet interface in the second pair of switch, use RJ45-x(x is the sequence number for the port)
not recommand to change this value
For ROUZIC hardware, the Switch_Port value need not to be set

It is IP_ADDR within SI_EXTNET_{#}_HOST_{##}_ARGS for sigtran1 in siteinfo

option.name: float.address
option.comment: floating IP address of station 0-0-1/0-0-9 for OAM connection
It is mapped to SI_EXTERNAL_FLOATING_IP in siteinfo

option.name: floatIP_mode
option.comment: mode for VIP brought up to control source IP binding.
Validate value: none, bounce, down

none: Static IP is brought up first (primary), and is used for source IP binding. At some point later, node transitions to Active, VIP is brought up. Static IP remains primary and is continued to be used for source IP binding.

bounce: Static IP is brought up first (primary), and is used for source IP binding. At some point later, node transitions to Active, VIP is brought up. VIP has static_handling set to bounce. After VIP is brought up, Static IP is torn down and brought back up. VIP becomes primary and is used for source IP binding.

If down. Static IP is brought up first (primary), and is used for source IP binding. At some point later, node transitions to Active, VIP is brought up. VIP has static_handling set to down. After VIP is brought up, Static IP is torn down. VIP becomes primary (only IP still up), and is used for source IP binding.
It is mapped to SI_EXTERNAL_FLOATING_IP_STATIC_HANDLING in siteinfo

option.name: Switch_Port
option.comment: physical Port in internal switch
not recommand to change this value
For ROUZIC hardware, the Switch_Port value need not to be set

option.name: Source_IP_Routing_enable
option.comment: value should be yes or no
if yes,source ip routing and destination routing will be both effective
if not, only destination routing will be effective
for ROUZIC hardware, the value will be unconcerned

option.name: float.address
option.comment: floating IP address of station 0-0-1/0-0-9 for secondary provisioning connection
It is IP_ADDR within SI_EXTNET_{#}_HOST_{##}_ARGS for SecP in siteinfo

option.name: 0-0-1.address
option.comment: IP address of station 0-0-1 for secondary provisioning connection
It is IP_ADDR within SI_EXTNET_{#}_HOST_{##}_ARGS for SecP in siteinfo

option.name: 0-0-9.address
option.comment: IP address of station 0-0-9 for secondary provisioning connection
It is IP_ADDR within SI_EXTNET_{#}_HOST_{##}_ARGS for SecP in siteinfo

option.name: floatIP_mode
option.comment: mode for VIP brought up to control source IP binding.
Validate value: none, bounce, down

none: Static IP is brought up first (primary), and is used for source IP binding. At some point later, node transitions to Active, VIP is brought up. Static IP remains primary and is continued to be used for source IP binding.

bounce: Static IP is brought up first (primary), and is used for source IP binding. At some point later, node transitions to Active, VIP is brought up. VIP has static_handling set to bounce. After VIP is brought up, Static IP is torn down and brought back up. VIP becomes primary and is used for source IP binding.

If down. Static IP is brought up first (primary), and is used for source IP binding. At some point later, node transitions to Active, VIP is brought up. VIP has static_handling set to down. After VIP is brought up, Static IP is torn down. VIP becomes primary (only IP still up), and is used for source IP binding.
It is VIP mode within SI_EXTNET_{#}_HOST_{##}_ARGS for SecP in siteinfo

option.name: Route_Target
option.comment: When hardware is ROUZIC or Source_IP_Routing_enable is yes, Route_Target value will not be necessary. Otherwise,route information for secondary privisioning traffic explicitly.
each ip address will be seperated by white space
It is DEST_IP_ADDR within SI_EXTNET_{#}_ROUTE_{##}_ARGS in siteinfo

option.name: Enable
option.comment: If YES, LDAP subnet will be configured and LDAP server will be started on specified blade. Below parameters about ip configuration must be configured
If NO, LDAP will not be enable
For LDAP and OAM shared case, this option must be set "yes". Below parameters should not be configured

option.name: Gateway
option.comment: IP address of gateway for LDAP traffic
It is GATEWAY within SI_EXTNET_{#}_ROUTE_{##}_ARGS in siteinfo
For ROUZIC hardware, the Gateway value need not to be set

option.name: DSCP_Enable
option.comment: DSCP enable flag for LDAP
Workable only when global DSCP is enabled;if it is yes ,DSCP for LDAP will be enabled, else DSCP for LDAP will be disabled

option.name: DSCP_Value
option.comment: DSCP value for LDAP connection, only work when both global and LDAP DSCP_Enable are set to yes

option.name: VLAN_ID
option.comment: If VLAN_ID is set, the vlan tag is enabled
If not, the vlan tag is disabled
VLAN ID for LDAP Traffic on uplinks to customer router/switch
VLAN ID range is 2 ~ 4096
For ROUZIC hardware, the VLAN_ID need not to be set

option.name: Interface
option.comment: ethx or ethx/ethy
recommended value is generated through gen_siteinfo.py -t per different hardware
BONO is eth4/eth5 and HP is eth0/eth1 for LDAP traffic
not recommand to change this value
For ROUZIC hardware, the Interface value need not to be set

option.name: Switch_Port
option.comment: physical Port in internal switch
not recommand to change this value
For ROUZIC hardware, the Switch_Port value need not to be set

option.name: Source_IP_Routing_enable
option.comment: value should be yes or no
if yes,source ip routing and destination routing will be both effective
if not, only destination routing will be effective
for ROUZIC hardware, the value will be unconcerned

option.name: RESERVED.PILOT1.address
option.comment: IP address of 0-0-1 station for LDAP traffic
This parameter is mandatory for FlexPro feature
This parameter is mandatory once RESERVED.PILOT2.address is configured.
It is mapped to RESERVED.PILOT1.IP for [LDAP.IPV*.NETWORK.1] in ldap.ini

option.name: RESERVED.PILOT2.address
option.comment: IP address of 0-0-9 station for LDAP traffic
This parameter is mandatory for FlexPro feature
This parameter is mandatory once RESERVED.PILOT1.address is configured.
It is mapped to RESERVED.PILOT2.IP for [LDAP.IPV*.NETWORK.1] in ldap.ini

option.name: PILOT.enable
option.comment: Flag to control whether pilot will be started as LDAP server
NO stands for LDAP server will not be started on pilot, YES means pilot will be start LDAP server
This parameter requires pilot.address to be configured once its value is yes.

option.name: PILOT.address
option.comment: floating IP address of station 0-0-1/0-0-9 for LDAP traffic
It is mapped to ADDRESS for [LDAP:PILOT] in ldap.ini

option.name: PILOT.LDAP_BASIC_ACTIVATED
option.comment: LDAP server enables the non secured port listening.
If LDAP_SECURED_ACTIVATED is set to false,LDAP_BASIC_ACTIVATED should be set to true
The VALID VALUE: true or false

option.name: PILOT.LDAP_SECURED_ACTIVATED
option.comment: LDAP server enables the secured port listening
If LDAP_BASIC_ACTIVATED is set to false,LDAP_SECURED_ACTIVATED should be set to true
The VALID VALUE: true or false

option.name: PILOT.LDAP_PROXY.STD_PORT
option.comment: Set the port for LDAP proxy non secured listening port

option.name: PILOT.LDAP_PROXY.TLS_PORT
option.comment: Set the port for LDAP proxy secured listening port

option.name: PILOT.LDAP_SERVER_INSTANCE_NUMBER
option.comment: This parameter is used only with "dsmgtDB"(management database)
This option allows to launch up to 4 LDAP servers (third party) per blade

option.name: Enable
option.comment: SIGTRAN traffic is on dual subnet configuration,one pair of blades will be defined as I/O blade
Each blade will be configured with one IP address in each subnet
If YES, sigtran1 traffic will be enabled. Below parameters about ip configuration must be configured
else, below parameters will be ignored

option.name: DSCP_Enable
option.comment: DSCP enable flag for SIGTRAN1 traffic
Workable only when global DSCP is enabled;if it is yes ,DSCP for sigtran1 traffic will be enabled, else DSCP for sigtran1 traffic will be disabled

option.name: DSCP_Value
option.comment: DSCP value for sigtran1 traffic connection, only work when DSCP_Enable is set to yes

option.name: Gateway
option.comment: IP address of gateway for sigtran1 traffic
The gateway can't be same as the one in sigtran2 traffic
It is GATEWAY within SI_EXTNET_{#}_ROUTE_{##}_ARGS in siteinfo

option.name: VLAN_ID
option.comment: If VLAN_ID is set, the vlan tag is enabled
If not, the vlan tag is disabled
VLAN ID for Sigtran1 Traffic on uplinks to customer router/switch
VLAN ID range is 2 ~ 4096
For ROUZIC hardware, the VLAN_ID need not to be set

option.name: Interface
option.comment: ethx or ethx/ethy
recommended value is generated through gen_siteinfo.py -t per different hardware
BONO is eth4 and HP is eth0 for Sigtran1 traffic
not recommand to change this value

option.name: Switch_Port
option.comment: physical Port in internal switch
For HP lab, if use 10/100MB Ethernet interface in the second pair of switch, use RJ45-x(x is the sequence number for the port)
not recommand to change this value
For ROUZIC hardware, the Switch_Port value need not to be set

option.name: 0-0-2.address
option.comment: IP address of blade 0-0-2 for sigtran1 traffic
It is IP_ADDR within SI_EXTNET_{#}_HOST_{##}_ARGS for sigtran1 in siteinfo

option.comment: IP address of blade 0-0-3 for sigtran1 traffic
It is IP_ADDR within SI_EXTNET_{#}_HOST_{##}_ARGS for sigtran1 in siteinfo

option.name: 0-0-14.address
option.comment: IP address of blade 0-0-14 for sigtran1 traffic
It is IP_ADDR within SI_EXTNET_{#}_HOST_{##}_ARGS for sigtran1 in siteinfo

option.name: Route_Target
option.comment: Route inforamtion for sigtran1 traffic explicitly
each ip address will be seperated by white space
It is mapped to ROUTES in siteinfo

option.name: Enable
option.comment: SIGTRAN traffic is on dual subnet configuration,one pair of blades will be defined as I/O blade
Each blade will be configured with one IP address in each subnet
If YES, sigtran2 traffic will be enabled. Below parameters about ip configuration must be configured
else, below parameters will be ignored

option.name: DSCP_Enable
option.comment: DSCP enable flag for sigtran2 traffic
Workable only when global DSCP is enabled;if it is yes ,DSCP for sigtran2 traffic will be enabled, else DSCP for sigtran2 trafficc will be disabled

option.name: DSCP_Value
option.comment: DSCP value for sigtran2 traffic connection, only work when DSCP_Enable is set to yes

option.name: Gateway
option.comment: IP address of gateway for sigtran2 traffic
The gateway can't be same as the one in sigtran2 traffic
It is GATEWAY within SI_EXTNET_{#}_ROUTE_{##}_ARGS in siteinfo

option.name: VLAN_ID
option.comment: If VLAN_ID is set, the vlan tag is enabled
If not, the vlan tag is disabled
VLAN ID for Sigtran2 Traffic on uplinks to customer router/switch
For ROUZIC hardware, the VLAN_ID need not to be set
VLAN ID range is 2 ~ 4096

option.name: Interface
option.comment: ethx or ethx/ethy
recommended value is generated through gen_siteinfo.py -t per different hardware
BONO is eth5 and HP is eth1 for Sigtran2 traffic
not recommand to change this value

option.name: Switch_Port
option.comment: physical Port in internal switch
For HP lab, if use 10/100MB Ethernet interface in the second pair of switch, use RJ45-x(x is the sequence number for the port)
not recommand to change this value
For ROUZIC hardware, the Switch_Port value need not to be set

option.name: 0-0-2.address
option.comment: IP address of blade 0-0-2 for sigtran2 traffic
It is IP_ADDR within SI_EXTNET_{#}_HOST_{##}_ARGS for sigtran2 in siteinfo

option.name: Enable
option.comment: If YES, this NRG will be enabled. Below parameters about ip configuration must be configured
else, below parameters will be ignored

option.name: PILOT.A.ADDRESS
option.comment: IP address of pilot 0-0-1 in NRG network
It is PILOT1.ADDRESS within NRG.{#}.ZONE.{#} in repl.ini

option.name: PILOT.B.ADDRESS
option.comment: IP address of pilot 0-0-9 in NRG network
It is PILOT2.ADDRESS within NRG.{#}.ZONE.{#} in repl.ini

option.name: GMPS.ADDRESS
option.comment: IP address of GMPS floating in NRG network
It is GMPS.ADDRESS within NRG.{#}.ZONE.{#} in repl.ini

option.name: PILOT.A.HOSTNAME
option.comment: hostname of pilot 0-0-1 in NRG network
It is PILOT1.HOSTNAME within NRG.{#}.ZONE.{#} in repl.ini
this hostname should be different with any other hostname in BE.NETWORK.NRG.xx.ZONE.xx

option.name: PILOT.B.HOSTNAME
option.comment: hostname of pilot 0-0-9 in NRG network
It is PILOT2.HOSTNAME within NRG.{#}.ZONE.{#} in repl.ini
this hostname should be different with any other hostname in BE.NETWORK.NRG.xx.ZONE.xx

option.name: GMPS.HOSTNAME
option.comment: GMPS hostname for NRG network
It is GMPS.HOSTNAME within NRG.{#}.ZONE.{#} in repl.ini
this hostname should be different with any other hostname in BE.NETWORK.NRG.xx.ZONE.xx

option.name: NDB.ADDRESS
option.comment: IP address of NDB address in NRG network
It is ADDRESS within NRG.{#}.ZONE.{#} in distributed.ini

option.name: NDB.HOSTNAME
option.comment: NDB hostname for NRG network

option.name: logLevel
option.comment: log levels will be set for all diameter instances
ERR level allows to obtain all the problems relative to errors happening during linux system calls
WARN level allows to obtain any problems relative to the receiving/sending of messages on both directions due to temporary conditions. Eg. overload problems pertain to LOG category
METER level allows to retrieve a periodically (every 15 seconds) statistics about diameter frames received and sent by the LB in both directions
INFO level allows to retrieve a first level of traces in order to understand what happened on specific event occurrences
DEBUG1 level allows to trace all the diameter frames received/sent by the LB in both directions

option.name: Malban7_external_interface_1
option.comment: Malban 7 external interface 1 on Malban0

option.name: Malban7_external_interface_1_IP
option.comment: ip address for Malban 7 external interface 1. It is only used within malban by iLB, isn't exposed to customer edge router.Need to set Malban7_external_interface_1_IP and Malban8_external_interface_2_IP in one internal network which must be not conflict with LSN network and another iLB internal network which Malban7_external_interface_2_IP and Malban8_external_interface_1_IP will belong to

option.name: Malban7_external_interface_2
option.comment: Malban 7 external interface 1 on Malban0

option.name: Malban7_external_interface_2_IP
option.comment: ip address for Malban 7 external interface 2. It is only used within malban by iLB, isn't exposed to customer edge router.Need to set Malban7_external_interface_2_IP and Malban8_external_interface_1_IP in one internal network which must be not conflict with LSN network and another iLB internal network which Malban7_external_interface_1_IP and Malban8_external_interface_2_IP will belong to

option.name: Malban8_external_interface_2

option.name: Malban8_external_interface_2_IP
option.comment: ip address for Malban 8 external interface 2. option.name: Farm_name
option.comment: Farm name for SCTP mode

option.name: ip_version
option.comment: v4 or v6
ip version for this farm

option.name: LB_External_Port
option.comment: LB External Port
not recommand to change this port number

option.name: splitting_servers
option.comment: RT blades that LB splits diameter connection to
servers running LB should not be included in this list

option.name: splitting_servers_port
option.comment: Diameter internal Port
Application port numbers for splitting server which LB will distribute traffic of application that set in DIAMETER to
Operator should make sure the ports keep pace with the value for diameter serverPortNumber in OAM
Please check constraints defined for External Port Number on a per Application basis
Use white space to separate different ports

option.name: DSCP_Enable
option.comment: DSCP enable flag for LB
Workable only when global DSCP is enabled
When iLB has been installed, run iLB "Upgrade" to apply change

option.name: DSCP_Value
option.comment: DSCP value for LB connection
When iLB has been installed, run iLB "Upgrade" to apply change

option.name: Subnet1_LB_External.address
option.comment: float ip for LB blade. It is exposed to diameter NE, such as CSCF
NOTE: this address is unique for each diameter instance

option.name: Subnet1_Gateway
option.comment: If this farm is sctp dual-home, this is gateway IP address in subnet1
If this farm is sctp mono-home, this is Front Router1's IP address in Private_VLAN2

option.name: Subnet1_Route_Target
option.comment: External ip or network of destination for diameter traffic
Several destinations can be separated with white space

option.name: Subnet2_LB_External.address
option.comment: float ip for LB blade. It is exposed to diameter NE, such as CSCF
NOTE: this address is unique for each diameter instance

option.name: Subnet2_Gateway
option.comment: IP address of gateway for farm SCTP subnet2

option.name: Subnet2_Route_Target
option.comment: External ip or network of destination for diameter traffic
Several destinations can be separated with white space

option.name: pollOverloadPeriod
option.comment: Expressed in seconds
This is the period used to determine if the overload conditions towards a client/server is over.

option.name: serverHighWaterMark
option.comment: Expressed in Kbytes
Threshold from which we decide to isolate the server/LB stops sending traffic to this server

option.name: serverLowWaterMark
option.comment: Expressed in Kbytes
Threshold from which we decide to put the server back in service/LB starts sending traffic to this server

option.name: clientHighWaterMark
option.comment: Expressed in Kbytes
Threshold from which we decide to delete PDUs which are addresses to this client

option.name: clientLowWaterMark
option.comment: Expressed in Kbytes
Threshold from which we decide to accept again PDUs for this client

option.name: rto_initial
option.comment: This is the initial value of RTO(retransmission timeout) that is used in RTO calculations

option.name: rto_min
option.comment: This is the minimum value of RTO(retransmission timeout) that is used in RTO calculations.

option.name: rto_max
option.comment: This is the maximum value of RTO(retransmission timeout) that is used in RTO calculations.

option.name: hb_interval
option.comment: This is the interval when a HEARTBEAT chunk is sent to a destination transport address to monitor the reachability of an idle destination transport address.

option.name: path_max_retrans
option.comment: Maximum number of consecutive retransmissions over a destination transport address of a peer endpoint before it is marked as inactive.

option.name: valid_cookie_life
option.comment: This is the maximum lifespan of the Cookie sent in an INIT ACK chunk.

option.name: association_max_retrans
option.comment: Maximum number of consecutive retransmissions to a peer before an endpoint considers that the peer is unreachable and closes the association.

option.name: max_init_retransmits
option.comment: Maximum number of times an INIT chunk or a COOKIE ECHO chunk is retransmitted before an endpoint aborts the initialization process and closes the association.

option.name: addHostIPAddress
option.comment: This option is for RDS 19200 Feature
By default the feature to add source ip/port in CER is diabled
To activate this feature, you have to set true for this option
